title: Driver ploughs into crowd of pedestrians in Heidelberg, Germany, leaving three people injured
text:
News Driver ploughs into crowd of pedestrians in Heidelberg, Germany, leaving three people injured Initial reports suggest it was a deliberate attack by the driver, who was hunted down and shot by police during a standoff in the street Share By Sam Rkaina Chris kitching 17:20, 25 FEB 2017 Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Man shot by police after driving into pedestrians in Germany Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Three people were taken to hospital with injuries after a car was driven into a crowd of pedestrians in a central square in Heidelberg, Germany. 
Initial reports suggest it was a deliberate attack by the driver, who was hunted down and shot by police in a street in front of terrified witnesses. 
Police say the suspect was armed with a knife when he ploughed into the pedestrians in front of a bakery at around 4pm local time on Saturday. 
Witnesses pointed him out to police as he fled on foot and he was shot during a standoff in front of a row of shops and flats. Footage posted online purportedly shows the moment police shot the driver (Photo: Twitter / @APetchoice) The car had ploughed into a crowd of pedestrians (Photo: Twitter / @APetchoice) 
Footage posted on Twitter showed the moment the knife-wielding suspect was shot by police. 
Police said the suspect was seriously injured in the shooting and was in hospital. 
Terrorism was not suspected and the man is thought to have acted alone, said police. 
Local media reports suggested the man was suffering from mental health issues. Forensic officers investigate at the scene (Photo: Twitter @raphael_rauch) The area has been cordoned off by police (Photo: Twitter / @ PoliceMannheim) 
The incident occurred in a pedestrian area in Bismarckplatz in the picturesque city in south-western Germany. 
Hours later forensics teams in white outfits were seen examining the black three-door car after it was cordoned off. 
In December an attacker deliberately drove a lorry into the Christmas market in Berlin, killing 12 people and injuring more than 50. 
That attack was claimed by the terror group ISIS. Like us on Facebook
